723751f.title: Manhattan: Varick Street - Broome Street
723751f.text:
107 Varick Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Broome Street.
This is one of the houses in the block demolished in the 1920's
for the Holland Tunnel Entrance Plaza.
June 11, 1914.
Vh;rta Rrothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723751f.folder: Varick Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

717887f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Varick Street
717887f-a.text:
Chureh of our Lady of Vilna, 570 Broome Street, adjoining the
N. W. corner of Varick.
September 27,1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717887f-a.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

723750f-a.title: Manhattan: Varick Street - Broome Street
723750f-a.text:
Varick Street, west side, south from Broome Street, showing in
the foreground the Holland Tunnel Plaza. This was taken shortly
after the opening of the tunnel, and about a year before the de-
molition of the old houses on the south or Watts Street side of
the Plaza.
February 12, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723750f-a.folder: Varick Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

723749f-a.title: Manhattan: Varick Street - Broome Street
723749f-a.text:
Holland Tunnel Plaza, Varick Street, west side, from Broome
to Watts Streets, showing vehicles headed for the entrance to
the tunnel.
February 12, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723749f-a.folder: Varick Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

717886f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Varick Street
717886f-a.text:
558, 556 and 554 Broome Street, at, adjoining and east of
the N.E. corner of Varick Street (foreground), as viewed across
a gas station at the S.E. corner. The five story stable adioinlng
the corner structure (which also bears No. 110-112 Varick Street)
is No. 556 Broome Street.
Nov. 9, 1930
L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
717886f-a.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

717888f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Varick Street
717888f-a.text:
Holland Tunnel Plaza, Broome Street, north side, from Varick
Street to Hudson.
June 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717888f-a.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

717889f-b.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Varick Street
717889f-b.text:
Broome Street, north side, between Varick and Hudson
Streets. Officials of the New York Port Authority, City
of New York and the State of New dersey at the Manhattan
mouth of the completed Holland Tunnel. TRe photoarapher
is viewing southward from inside ofsame and shows in the
background the later demolished 2 1/2 story buildings on
the south side of Broome Street.
Spring 1927.
MAY BE RECRODUCED.
The toll gates outside of the tunnel entrance.
1936
W. P. A. photo
Pederal Writers Project
Credit Line Imperative
717889f-b.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

717890f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Varick Street
717890f-a.text:
Broome Street, north side, between Varick and Hudson Streets,
showing three distinct stages of the Holland Tunnel entrance.
The photographer is viewing northward in all instances.
Note in No. 3 the office structure that replaced teneients
to the west of the adit. This is the Boarc of Transportation Build.
ing occupying tne frontage on the east side of Hudson from Broome
to Dominick Street's.
View 1: Oct. 10, 1927
View 2: Dec. 7, 1927
L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
W. P. A. Photo
Federal Workers Project  View 3:  1936
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE.

717891f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Varick Street
717891f-a.text:
(1)
Broome Street, north side, from No. 586, east of Hudson Street,
to Varick Street, showing she entrance to the Holland Vehicular
Tunnel and the original ticket booths, shortly after the opening
of the tunnel.
December 7, 1927.
L. Sperr.
No PEPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same,nearly a year later, after demolition of the buildings
between Hudson Street and the Tunnel entrance.
October 11,1928.
P. L. Sperr.
No REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, at a later date. Also shown (left) is Hudson Street,
north from and iweindire Bronme to Vanda Streets witw tbe 9-story
building of the Henry Heide Candy Manufacturing Co. occupying the
block from Spring to Vandam Streets.
February 20, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
717891f-a.folder: Broome Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY
